subject: Photography
title: Food Photography
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Food Photography.

hook.text: That restaurant menu photo that makes you hungry? A food photographer spent hours making it look that good.

buildup.text: Food photography uses careful lighting, styling, and composition to make dishes look irresistible.

discovery.text: Side lighting from a window creates texture on surfaces. Overhead angles work for flat dishes. Angles matter.

twist.text: Food stylists use tricks: motor oil as syrup, cardboard in burgers for height, glue as milk. It's theater.

climax.text: Instagram turned everyone into a food photographer. Professional food photography had to raise its game in response.

punchline.text: Food photography: making you hungry with your eyes.

quiz.question: Why do food stylists sometimes use non-food substitutes?
options: Real food wilts quickly under lights; substitutes hold their shape
